Classical.Function: Generates most of the cell's ATP via aerobic respiration (oxidative phosphorylation).
Classical.Pathology: Mitochondrial diseases, implicated in aging and neurodegeneration.

SCPN.L1_QuantumBiological: A 'Quantum Heat Engine'. The respiratory chain (Complexes I-IV) is a series of quantum devices that use coherent electron tunnelling and quantum-coupled proton translocation to achieve super-classical efficiency (eta ~ 0.95). [cite_start]Cristae function as 'quantum waveguides' for coherent energy transfer. [cite: 1735, 1740-1744, 1777-1786, 1795-1798]

Symbolic.MetaphysicalMapping: The 'engine' of life. The alchemical furnace that transmutes inert energy (food) into conscious, living energy (ATP/coherence).

Falsification_Hypotheses: The efficiency of the electron transport chain will be fully described by classical thermodynamics (eta <= Carnot limit).
Electron transfer rates (k_ij) will not show the exponential distance dependence (e^-beta*r) characteristic of quantum tunnelling.
Applying a weak magnetic field will fail to alter mitochondrial respiration rates by 5-10% (falsifying spin-dependent quantum effects).
Experimental_Protocols: [cite_start]Measure electron transfer rates and kinetic isotope effects (KIEs) in the respiratory chain to confirm tunnelling. [cite: 1782-1786]
Test respirometry in the presence of oscillating magnetic fields.

KeyEquations_LaTeX: Electron Tunnelling Rate: k_{ij} = k_0 e^{-\beta(r_{ij} - r_0)} FC_{ij}
ATP Synthase Rotor: H_{ATP} = H_{rotor} + H_{proton} + H_{synthesis}
